strict_scoring_rules.description: Enforces realistic score distribution and proper penalties

no_output_no_points.rule: Code cell without output = 0 points for that section

template_only_cap.rule: Template-only submission capped at 10% of total
template_only_cap.detection: Less than 30% code added beyond template

missing_section_zero.enforcement: No partial credit for missing work

completion_based_scoring.description: Maximum score limited by completion percentage
completion_based_scoring.enforcement: Cannot score higher than completion allows

differentiation_required.description: AI must differentiate between quality levels
differentiation_required.warning: If all scores are 80-90%, AI is being too lenient

incorrect_approach.penalty: 50% of section points if approach is fundamentally wrong
incorrect_approach.example: Using wrong join type = 6/12 points maximum

reweighted_categories.description: Technical skills matter more than soft skills
reweighted_categories.rationale: Code correctness and analysis are objective; thinking and communication are subjective and AI is too generous

critical_instructions: NO OUTPUT = 0 POINTS for that section (absolute rule)
TEMPLATE ONLY = Maximum 10% of total points (3.75/37.5)
WRONG OUTPUT = Maximum 25% credit for that section
COMPLETION LIMITS SCORE = Cannot score higher than completion percentage
- Excellent (90-100%): All complete, all correct, exceptional quality
- Good (80-89%): Mostly complete, minor errors, good quality
- Adequate (70-79%): Some incomplete, several errors, acceptable
- Poor (60-69%): Much incomplete, major errors, barely passing
- Failing (0-59%): Template only or mostly incomplete
DO NOT give everyone 85%. Spread scores based on actual work quality.
Perfect work deserves 95%+. Incomplete work deserves 60-70%.
